sentences.english: And take a Life that wearies me.
sentences.chinese: 死神，把厌烦我的生命攫取。

sentences.english: The Birmingham News reports someone has accessed Gregory's bank account since the kidnapping.
sentences.chinese: 报道说，在绑架案发生后有人攫取了乔治的银行存款。

sentences.english: Robert Tollison, "Rent seeking is the expenditure of scarce resources to capture an artificially created transfer."
sentences.chinese: 寻租是耗费稀缺资源攫取的一种人为创造的财产转移。

sentences.english: Under the cover of the smog, He snatched the pot on the sly.
sentences.chinese: 在烟雾的掩护下，他偷偷地攫取了那只罐子。

sentences.english: Capital appropriates the surplus value, a process referred to as exploitation of labor.
sentences.chinese: 私有资本攫取剩余价值，即对劳动的剥削过程。

sentences.english: What the hand dare seize the fire?
sentences.chinese: 敢用什么手攫取这火种？

sentences.english: To plagiarize means to take the writings of another person and to use them as your own.
sentences.chinese: 剽窃就是攫取他人的作品并当成自己的使用。

sentences.english: In me the cave-man clasps the seer.
sentences.chinese: 于我，穴居人攫取了先知。

sentences.english: She snatched a paper out and held it behind her.
sentences.chinese: 她攫取了一张纸片，攥住它，然后背过手去。

sentences.english: This gives us opportunity to grab market share.
sentences.chinese: 这就给了我们攫取市场份额的机会。

sentences.english: Mr Cohen said he buyers would be keen to grab well-presented properties.
sentences.chinese: 科恩说，他的买家将热衷于攫取良好陈述性质。

sentences.english: The usurious that it is seize embellish, pleasant should hit one gun to change the guerrilla of a place.
sentences.chinese: 为攫取高利润，甘当打一枪换一个地方的游击队。

sentences.english: Capitalists buy and then sell things to make a profit.
sentences.chinese: 资本家们先买后卖，进而攫取利润。

sentences.english: He's always scrounging off his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他总是擅自攫取他朋友的东西。

sentences.english: The entire empire was highly inspired by the desire of grasping the wire bire.
sentences.chinese: 整个帝国被攫取电线胎的欲望所鼓动起来。

definition: to seek/to strive for/to obtain/see also 牟取[mou2 qu3]
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/see also 謀取|谋取[mou2 qu3]
to fish for/to seek profit (by improper means)
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
to extract/to squeeze out (juice etc)/(fig.) to exploit
to take cities and seize territories (idiom)
to covet/to long for/to lust after
